job_title: Animal Care Assistant in Balerno, Scotland
pros: Animal welfare is a top priority for me, hours are decent enough. Recent review on opening times been welcomed and is working well.
cons:
But.....this is a charity in crisis. What a waste of so much talent, very high turnover of good staff that puts a strain on resources and wastes an abysmal amount of money. Full of pointless strategic reviews with leadership, processes and training and not fit for purpose. Every change is a fiasco and there is no joined up thinking at any point in the organisation.  And its nothing to do with Covid.

It’s getting increasingly difficult to get a task done here. For us its a tough working environment created by the Management.  They have been spoken to about it so many times only for their behaviour to decline further soon after. We avoid HR on speaking up about it as it will only make things worse. Management are constantly aggressive and always out looking for confrontation including with our Inspectors next door. Will often change rules on the fly in order to have an excuse to have a go that you did something wrong.

pros: Working with the animals seeing them go into caring new homes
cons: Bad practices such as bullying and fraud get swept under the carpet to avoid bad publicity for the Charity. If you complain and raise a grievance over such issues Senior Management and HR turn it around and try to silence you and get rid of you. They don't like whistle-blowers. Several years have now passed since I left and I still suffer either recurring nightmares. Feel as though I will never be mentally free of this organisation

pros: Learned loads, really supportive Director and Manager with lots of experience and wanted me to do well. Got to take lead on new ways of fundraising and develop my confidence and skills.
cons: Felt pulled into some of the catty behaviour towards my manager and Director. The culture wasn’t nice and some colleagues would do anything to undermine others, especially toward Director who was really nice to us. It was like playground bullying and childish.

review_title: Choose another charity to work for
pros: If you're an animal then you are certainly well treated. I have no issue with their charitable activities.
cons:
A constant turn over of staff (and it is constant) is usually due to toxic management and in this case, includes the neglect of the CEO and HR to address bullying and lying by senior management staff members.

No work/life balance. A lot of fake pleasantries but in the end no help when a favoured senior staff member bullies you - they just hope that you leave or they find a reason to get rid of you in your probationary period.
